intro: Bermudiana tolucensis, commonly known as the Mexican firecracker, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the genus Bermudiana and is part of the family Acanthaceae. The plant is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that range in color from red to orange, often with contrasting yellow or white markings. It thrives in warm, humid climates and is often found in moist, well-drained soils. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens and greenhouses.
